alert.note: Alert for Cook; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 10:55PM CDT until July 28 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Will County in northeastern Illinois... Southeastern Cook County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 1145 PM CDT. * At 1055 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Batavia to Shorewood to near Morris, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of producing wind damage in Kendall County. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Joliet, Hammond, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Calumet City, Chicago Heights, Roseland, Lansing, Oak Forest, Harvey, Lockport, New Lenox, Homer Glen, Blue Island, Munster, Dolton, Park Forest, Homewood and Alsip. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 235 and 249. I-57 between mile markers 325 and 355. I-80 between mile markers 123 and 124, and between mile markers 136 and 155. I-94 between mile markers 66 and 74. I-294 between mile markers 66 and 74. I-355 between mile markers 1 and 11. Indiana I-90 between mile markers 1 and 2. This includes... Windy City Thunderbolts Baseball, Channahon State Park, Hollywood Casino Amphitheatre, Governors State University, Moraine Valley Community College, Prairie State College, South Suburban College, and Will County Fairgrounds. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
